original: @19b # // rgya gar skad du /

translated: In Tibetan:

analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba mkha' 'gro ma sgyu ma bde ba'i mchog gi de kho na'i rtog pa thams cad bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i rgyud phyi ma'i yang phyi ma yis //
translated: are the essence of the tantra of the supreme illusory net of bliss of the dakinis, the union with all buddhas, called The Gathering of All Kalpas, the later of the later tantras.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud la sogs pa la brjod pa'i rtog pa'i don dang // rgyud phyi ma'i dang po'i sa chog dang // gdod ma dang tha ma med pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' dang / yig 'bru dang / sngags dbyung ba dang / shin tu dga' ba dang /

analyzed: shin tu bzang ba nyid dang / rdo rje snying po'i gtso bo nyid dang / sems dang sems dpa' dang / ting nge 'dzin dang // rdo rje dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po nyid dang / byang chub spyod pa dang /
translated: the state of supreme goodness, the state of being the chief of the vajra essence, the mind, the sattva, the samadhi, the vajra, the vajra holder, the state of being the great vajra holder, the conduct of enlightenment,

original: bdud dang bdud las rgyal pa dang / byang chub dang / sangs rgyas nyid dang / rdo rje gtum po mthar byed dang / phyag na rdo rje dang // dang po'i rigs bskyed pa dang / 'dod pa'i thar pa dang rnam pa gsum thams cad nyid dang /
analyzed: bdud dang bdud las rgyal pa dang / byang chub dang / sangs rgyas nyid dang / rdo rje gtum po mthar byed dang / phyag na rdo rje dang // dang po'i rigs bskyed pa dang / 'dod pa'i thar pa dang rnam pa gsum thams cad nyid dang /

analyzed: rtog pa'i dngos grub dang / gsang ba chen po lnga dang / de bzhin nyid chen po dang / dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo dang / rigs dang / dbang thams cad bskur ba dang / phyag rgya chen po'i tshig kyi de nyid dang / thams cad 'gugs pa dang /

analyzed: mchod pa chen po dang / byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa dang sgrub pa'o //

analyzed: de rnams kyi tshig dang don gyi 'khrul pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gyi bdag nyid kyi don du rig pa'i las thams cad bsal bar bya ba'i dngos grub thams cad 'grub par byed pa rnams gsungs pa /
translated: In order to remove the errors of the words and meanings of those, the concentration and the knowledge-mantra activities for the sake of the nature of concentration, all the accomplishments that cause the accomplishment of all the activities are taught.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag 'tshal te /

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: rnam rtog med ba'i sems la ni //

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /

analyzed: yang de kho na gsungs pa de kho na nyid nges par zhes pa ste /
translated: Again, that reality is stated as ‚Äúthe ascertainment of reality.‚Äù

analyzed: rtog pa'i don shes pa la sogs pa pa ngo bo ni de kho na nyid ces pa'o //
translated: The nature of the object of thought and so forth is called ‚Äúreality.‚Äù

analyzed: de'i nges pa la bzung ba'i ngo bo nyid gnas pa ni nges par @20b gnas zhes pa'o //

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i thams dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin bskyed pa'i chos kyi yi ges ni /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i thams dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin bskyed pa'i chos kyi yi ges ni /

translated: the adept, having repeatedly ascertained and generated, realizes. This is the basis for those who know the meaning of the tantra.

original: de bas de 'dra ba la ni /
analyzed: de bas de 'dra ba la ni /
translated: Therefore, in such a case,

original: de kho na nyid nges par gnas zhes so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid nges par gnas zhes so //

original: des ni chos kyi phyag rgya gtso bor gyur pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu 'di yin no //

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs su gsungs pa'i chos kyi phyag rgya yis ni rtog pa thams cad 'dus pa 'jug pa la bshad par byed do //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs su gsungs pa'i chos kyi phyag rgya yis ni rtog pa thams cad 'dus pa 'jug pa la bshad par byed do //
translated: The Dharma-mudra taught in the Vajrasattva family of the glorious Guhyasamaja is explained in the Avatara as the union of all concepts.

original: da ni chos kyi phyag rgyas gang grub par byed pa de ston pa ni /
analyzed: da ni chos kyi phyag rgyas gang grub par byed pa de ston pa ni /

analyzed: sems dpa' sangs rgyas kun gyi dngos //
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúThe hero is the actuality of all Buddhas.‚Äù

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /

original: de dag kyang bshad zin to //üîΩde ltar gzung ba'i tshig gis chos kyi phyag rgya la de kho na nyid gnas par gsungs nas /
analyzed: de dag kyang bshad zin to // de ltar gzung ba'i tshig gis chos kyi phyag rgya la de kho na nyid gnas par gsungs nas /

analyzed: de gnas pa'i man ngag gi tshig gis re zhig gsungs pa /
translated: he teaches the words of the intimate instruction of the reality of the Dharma-mudra.

original: 'dod chags chen po bde che la //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po bde che la //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat desire is great bliss.‚ÄùüîΩAnd so forth,

original: zhes pa nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas brtsams nas /

original: thams cad mi gsung 'os ma lags //üîΩzhes ji snyed pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: thams cad mi gsung 'os ma lags // zhes ji snyed pa'i bar du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll are not worthy of silence.‚Äù

original: da ni man ngag gi tshig rnams ston pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni man ngag gi tshig rnams ston pas gsungs pa /
translated: Now, having taught the words of the intimate instruction, he teaches the words of the intimate instruction of the reality of the Dharma-mudra.

original: de nas ston pa rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: de nas ston pa rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: ‚ÄúThen the teacher Vajradhara‚Äù

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: de la de nas zhes pa ni zhus pa'i de ma thag pa'i tshig de kho na'o //

original: skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du sems can gyi khams la rang gi bka' 'byor par byed pas ston pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du sems can gyi khams la rang gi bka' 'byor par byed pas ston pa zhes pa'o //
translated: He is called teacher because he is the master of his own word in the realm of sentient beings according to their fortune.

original: rdo rje 'dzin zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: Vajradhara is glorious Vajrasattva.

original: bka' stsal pa zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: It is connected with said.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin rtog pa la ni rtog pa kun gyi ces pa'o //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin rtog pa la ni rtog pa kun gyi ces pa'o //
translated: The nature of the ma·πá·∏çala of glorious Vajrasattva and so on is imagined in the imagination, all imaginations.

original: de dag gi gtso bo chen po zhes pa ni nam mkha'i khams thams cad la rtag tu gnas pa'i sku dang / gsung dang / thugs rdo rje bcom ldan 'das bskyed pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: de dag gi gtso bo chen po zhes pa ni nam mkha'i khams thams cad la rtag tu gnas pa'i sku dang / gsung dang / thugs rdo rje bcom ldan 'das bskyed pa'i rkyen to //
translated: The great lord of those is the condition for generating the BhagavƒÅn, the body, speech, and mind vajras, who always abide in the entire realm of space.

original: the tshom dag gis zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom dag gis zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla ba'o //
translated: By doubts and so on is easy to understand.

original: rnam par mi rtog chos dag la //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog chos dag la //
translated: In the nonconceptual Dharma,

original: zhes pa ni ji ltar gsungs pa'i dpal rdo rje sems @21a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ji ltar gsungs pa'i dpal rdo rje sems @21a * //
translated: as taught is glorious Vajrasattva.

original: dpa' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gzung 'dzin rnam par rtog pa med pa la zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dpa' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gzung 'dzin rnam par rtog pa med pa la zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is without the conceptualization of subject and object, such as the nature of a hero, etc.üîΩFor the sake of sentient beings, it is thoroughly imagined.

original: sems can don du yongs su rtog / ces pa ni 'dul ba'i sems can de dag gi don du dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub pa ni sems can don du yongs su rtog / ces pa'o //
analyzed: sems can don du yongs su rtog / ces pa ni 'dul ba'i sems can de dag gi don du dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub pa ni sems can don du yongs su rtog / ces pa'o //
translated: For the sake of those sentient beings to be trained, the accomplishment of the desired goal, such as glorious Vajrasattva, is for the sake of sentient beings, it is thoroughly imagined.

original: de'i don du rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid 'di sgra'i don du shes pa rjes su 'gro ba'i shes rab kyis phyogs bcur rnam par gzhag pa ni yongs su rtogs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don du rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid 'di sgra'i don du shes pa rjes su 'gro ba'i shes rab kyis phyogs bcur rnam par gzhag pa ni yongs su rtogs zhes pa'o //
translated: For that purpose, this reality of the ma·πá·∏çala, etc. of Vajrasattva, etc. is thoroughly imagined by the wisdom that follows the knowledge of the meaning of the words, and is established in the ten directions.

original: de phyir rtog par yang dag bshad //
analyzed: de phyir rtog par yang dag bshad //
translated: Therefore, it is explained as thoroughly imagined.

original: ces pa ni 'dul ba'i sems can gyi don gyi rgyud yin pa'i phyir dpal rdo rje sems dpa' kho nas rtogs par bshad do //
analyzed: ces pa ni 'dul ba'i sems can gyi don gyi rgyud yin pa'i phyir dpal rdo rje sems dpa' kho nas rtogs par bshad do //
translated: Because it is the cause of the continuum for the sake of sentient beings to be trained, it is explained that it is thoroughly imagined by glorious Vajrasattva alone.

original: rtog pa yongs su dag phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa yongs su dag phyir ro //
translated: Because the imagination is pure.

original: zhes pa ni 'dul ba'i sems can gyi khams gyi gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa spang pa'i don du zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dul ba'i sems can gyi khams gyi gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa spang pa'i don du zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement ‚Äúin order to abandon the conceptual thoughts of the apprehended and apprehender of the realm of sentient beings to be disciplined.‚Äù

original: de ltar rtog pa'i don shes pas dngos grub gsungs nas //
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa'i don shes pas dngos grub gsungs nas //
translated: Having thus taught the powers by knowing the meaning of the Tantra,

original: rgyud phyi ma'i don shes pa med na /
analyzed: rgyud phyi ma'i don shes pa med na /
translated: if one does not know the meaning of the Continuation Tantra,

original: dngos grub mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos grub mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: de bsal ba'i don du rgyud phyi ma'i don shes par gsungs pa /

original: 'di la ji ltar rgyud phyi ma yin zhe na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la ji ltar rgyud phyi ma yin zhe na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /

original: rgyud ni rab tu 'brel par bshad //
analyzed: rgyud ni rab tu 'brel par bshad //
translated: A tantra is explained as a connection.

original: ces pa ni rigs 'di lha thams cad kyi thun mong gi dkyil 'khor de kho na nyid la sogs pa 'brel pa ste /üîΩgsal bar byed pa'i sgra 'dus pa nye bar spyad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces pa ni rigs 'di lha thams cad kyi thun mong gi dkyil 'khor de kho na nyid la sogs pa 'brel pa ste / gsal bar byed pa'i sgra 'dus pa nye bar spyad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud ces gsungs so //
translated: This means that the mandala of all the deities of this family is connected with reality, and so forth.üîΩThe term ‚Äúclarifying‚Äù is a verbal affix.

original: phyi ma gong du phyung ba yin //
analyzed: phyi ma gong du phyung ba yin //
translated: The continuation is the one that was brought forth before.

original: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa'i sngon du /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa'i sngon du /
translated: Whether or not the Tathagatas arise, the nature of the present time, such as the Fortunate Eon, has always been the nature of glorious Vajrasattva, etc.

original: da lta'i dus kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rtag par gnas gcig cing mchog tu 'jig rten las 'das pa dam tshig chen po 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni rgyud phyi ma'i gong du byung ba'o //
analyzed: da lta'i dus kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rtag par gnas gcig cing mchog tu 'jig rten las 'das pa dam tshig chen po 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni rgyud phyi ma'i gong du byung ba'o //
translated: It is the supreme supramundane Great Vow, which has arisen in the past in the later tantras.

original: de kho na yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de kho na yang gsungs pa /
translated: That reality is also stated:

original: de nyid gsang ba gsang chen dag / de yang rgyud ni phyi mar 'dod //
analyzed: de nyid gsang ba gsang chen dag / de yang rgyud ni phyi mar 'dod //
translated: That reality, the great secret, is also considered the later tantra.

original: ces pa ste de nyid gsang ba gsang chen ni gong du bstan pas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ces pa ste de nyid gsang ba gsang chen ni gong du bstan pas shes par bya'o //
translated: That reality, the great secret, should be understood from the teaching above.

original: de yang zhes pa ni don de kho na nyid gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes pa ni don de kho na nyid gsungs pa'o //
translated: Also means that reality is taught.

original: des ni 'di gsung bar 'gyur te de nyid dang // gsang ba dang / gsang chen du gang @21b dang gang ston pa de dang de ni rgyud phyi ma zhes 'dir 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: des ni 'di gsung bar 'gyur te de nyid dang // gsang ba dang / gsang chen du gang @21b dang gang ston pa de dang de ni rgyud phyi ma zhes 'dir 'dod pa'o //
translated: This is what he says: Whatever is taught in the Root Tantra, the Continuation Tantra, the Subsequent Tantra, the Tantra of the True Nature, the Secret Tantra, and the Great Secret Tantra, that is accepted here as the Subsequent Tantra.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: gang dag 'jig rten gyi sbyor ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos de kho na nyid la sogs pa rnams de dag ni rtsa ba'i rgyud ces pa dang / gang dag 'jig rten las 'das pa dam tshig chen po'i de nyid rnams de dag ni rgyud phyi ma zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten gyi sbyor ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos de kho na nyid la sogs pa rnams de dag ni rtsa ba'i rgyud ces pa dang / gang dag 'jig rten las 'das pa dam tshig chen po'i de nyid rnams de dag ni rgyud phyi ma zhes 'dod do //
translated: Those that are worldly practices and the realities of the supramundane Dharma and so forth are called the Root Tantra, and those that are supramundane, the realities of the Great Commitment, are accepted as the Subsequent Tantra.

original: de ltar rgyud phyi ma zhes pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rgyud phyi ma zhes pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the Subsequent Tantra,

original: dang po'i sa'i de nyid ces pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dang po'i sa'i de nyid ces pa gsungs te /
translated: he speaks of the reality of the first stage.

original: 'di la ji ltar dang po'i sa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la ji ltar dang po'i sa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, it is said, How is it the first stage? and so forth.

original: phyogs bcu nas rdzas thams cad dngos po'i rang bzhin dngos po thams cad go 'byed pa sbyin pa'i ngo bo ni nam mkha' kun du zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu nas rdzas thams cad dngos po'i rang bzhin dngos po thams cad go 'byed pa sbyin pa'i ngo bo ni nam mkha' kun du zhes pa'o //
translated: From the ten directions, all substances, the nature of entities, and all things are the essence of generosity, which is the space that pervades everywhere.

original: de rab tu gnas pa gzhan gang de de ltar ro //
analyzed: de rab tu gnas pa gzhan gang de de ltar ro //
translated: That which is well-established in that way is another.

original: dbang po rdo rje dang / rin chen dang / padma dang / sna tshogs rdo rje dag gis byams pa de ni /
analyzed: dbang po rdo rje dang / rin chen dang / padma dang / sna tshogs rdo rje dag gis byams pa de ni /

original: rdo rje kun gyi dngos po mchog / ces pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje kun gyi dngos po mchog / ces pa'o //

analyzed: de nyid bde ba chen po bskyed pa'i phyir bde ba chen po zhes pa'o //

analyzed: da lta'i dus kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis rtag par gnas pas na /

original: dam pa'i yi ge gzhal yas khang //
analyzed: dam pa'i yi ge gzhal yas khang //

original: zhes pa ste brtan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste brtan pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar dang po'i sa'i de bzhin nyid kyi shes pa bstan nas /

analyzed: da ni rang byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa'i cho ga brtsams pa nas dkyil 'khor bsgom pa la de kho na nyid bsam pa'am /
translated: now, from the beginning of the rite of self-consecration, and so on, the one who wishes to meditate on the ma·πá·∏çala should contemplate suchness or

analyzed: mi skye bar ston pa'i sgra yig dang po la yig 'bru ka kha la sogs pa rnams dang / sgra yig aa la sogs pa bco lnga ni /

analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis kyis bskor ba'i spyi bo nas ma reg par zla gam gyis brgyan par bsams te /

analyzed: de'i dbus su zla ba'i yi ge rnams yid kyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ri mo bris nas de kho na brjod pas /

translated: The reply: The letter ka, and so on, in front of wisdom,

It is said: ‚ÄúHaving omitted the letters dha, nga, and nya, one should enter.‚ÄùüîΩHaving omitted the letter nga from the ka group and the letter nya from the ca group, one should mentally write the garland of sixteen letters, from ka to nga, on the moon at one‚Äôs heart, beginning from the right.

original: tshes drag zla ba gnyis yin te ;

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /

analyzed: gdod ma tha ma med mchog yin //

translated: How is that the BhagavƒÅn Vajra Essence? The phrase the supreme of the supreme and so forth refers to the supreme transformation of the supreme mundane and supramundane accomplishments, which are called the supreme accomplishment.

analyzed: chen po de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi grub pa ni kun gyi mchog ces pa'o //

analyzed: gdod ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings mngon du byas pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis dbang phyug chen po zhes pa'o //

analyzed: zhes pa ste /

analyzed: de'i yang 'dren pa zhes bya ba ni gsang ba chen po lnga ste /

analyzed: de kho na nyid ces pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i skad cig ma re re kho na las byung ba'o //

translated: Because of that elevation, it is the condition for the statement the principal one of the vajra essence, the glorious Vajrasattva, the great seal, and the goddesses.

analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /

analyzed: gsungs pa / gtso bo zhes pa ste dbang phyug gam khyab bdag gdod ma nas tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //

analyzed: de nyid dam pa dang skyes bu'o zhes pa ste /

translated: Because of the condition of generating the mere person of form by mere feeling, it is said to be the person.

analyzed: de kho na'i thams cad sems nyid gsungs pa / de la ji ltar @41a * //

analyzed: zhes pa dang 'brel to //

analyzed: de la rnal 'byor thams cad kyi bsam pa ni mi nus pa spyod yul nyid du ma gyur pa ni bsam med ces pa'o //

analyzed: kun du khyab pa ni rgya che zhes pa'o //

analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po bzhi gting thug par mi nus pa'i sems ni zab ces pa'o // dngos grub thams cad kyi bde ba skyed pa'i rkyen nyid kyis rtag par gnas pa ni /

original: dngos grub thams cad zad med bde //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad zad med bde //
translated: The inexhaustible bliss of all powers is the constant abode, the condition for the generation of bliss of all powers.üîΩThe inexhaustible bliss of all powers.

analyzed: zhes pa'o // de nyid kun khyab dri ma med //
translated: The all-pervading is the stainless.

original: ces pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i ngo bos sems kyi rgyud thams cad rjes su rtogs pa nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi dri ma med ba'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i ngo bos sems kyi rgyud thams cad rjes su rtogs pa nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi dri ma med ba'o //

original: de gang yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What is that? It is said:

original: byang chub sems bdag brtan pa yin //
analyzed: byang chub sems bdag brtan pa yin //
translated: The bodhisattva is firm in the mind of enlightenment.

original: zhes pa'o // rnal 'byor pas kyang ji ltar mngon du bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // rnal 'byor pas kyang ji ltar mngon du bya ba yin zhe na /

analyzed: de mngon du bya ba'i thabs gsungs pa /

original: sems brtan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yis //
analyzed: sems brtan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yis //

analyzed: de nyid sgrub pa'i mchog ces te /

original: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid 'thob po //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid 'thob po //

original: zhes pa ni shes sla'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes sla'o //

original: gsungs pa ni ji ltar gsungs pa'i mdun du /
analyzed: gsungs pa ni ji ltar gsungs pa'i mdun du /

analyzed: bzang po de yis phun sum gyi gzugs kyis sems can gyi don byed pa'o //

original: de kho na'i don gsungs pa /
analyzed: de kho na'i don gsungs pa /

original: snying stobs rdul zhes pa ste /
analyzed: snying stobs rdul zhes pa ste /

analyzed: rdul zhes pa ni 'dod chags so //

original: mun pa yang zhes pa ni ma rig pa'i mun pa'o //
analyzed: mun pa yang zhes pa ni ma rig pa'i mun pa'o //

original: tshig gsum kho nas stobs kyi lha dang / rab tu 'dod dang gnas pa'i mtha' dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug rnams dang gsang ba'i gzugs rnams gsungs pa'o //

translated: With only three words, he mentions the gods of power, the desire for the highest, the end of abiding, Mahe≈õvara, BrahmƒÅ, and Vi·π£·πáu, and the secret forms.

analyzed: ci'i phyir sems can don zhes pa la sogs pa ni shes sla'o //

original: ji bzhin byang sems spyod ces 'gro //

original: des phun sum sprul pa'i gzugs kyis ;
analyzed: des phun sum sprul pa'i gzugs kyis ;

analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can gyi don byed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i chos bzhi'o //

analyzed: byang chub kyi rjes su 'gro ba ni rjes su 'gro zhes pa'o //

analyzed: 'di las ji ltar bcom ldan 'das bdud dang bdud las rgyal ba yin zhe na /

original: de la sems de kho na bdud nyid de zhes ba ni bdud kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i sems ni bdud do //
analyzed: de la sems de kho na bdud nyid de zhes ba ni bdud kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i sems ni bdud do //

analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ni bdud nyid ces pa ste /

analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i bgegs rnams de sngon du ser sna bskyed pa'i phyir gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sems de kho na de bzhin gshegs //

analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtan la phab par 'gyur ba'i sems ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The mind that is the determination of the Tathagata is the Tathagata.

original: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i rkyen gtan la phab pa /üîΩbdud kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa /
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i rkyen gtan la phab pa / bdud kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa /
translated: That itself is the determination of the condition of the Tathagata.üîΩIt is free from the conceptualization of Mara.

original: bdud snang ba med pa'i phyir bdud las rgyal ba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bdud snang ba med pa'i phyir bdud las rgyal ba zhes pa'o //
translated: Because the appearance of Mara does not exist, it is called victorious over Mara.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i snying po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus brtan pa la bskyed par bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i snying po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus brtan pa la bskyed par bya ba'i don du /
translated: The bodhisattva's stable diligence is to be generated for the sake of the bodhisattva who abides in the essence of enlightenment.

original: lha'i bu'i gzugs kyis brtse bar byed pa'i bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa' ni bdud ces pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu'i gzugs kyis brtse bar byed pa'i bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa' ni bdud ces pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, glorious Vajrasattva, who is the one who is affectionate in the form of a son of the gods, for the sake of generating the firm effort of the bodhisattva who is situated in the essence of enlightenment, is the ‚Äúdemon.‚Äù

original: de ltar gsungs pa ji ltar 'dod pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas lha'i bu'i gzugs kyis /
analyzed: de ltar gsungs pa ji ltar 'dod pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas lha'i bu'i gzugs kyis /
translated: Thus, the Blessed One Vajrasattva, as he is desired, in the form of a son of the gods,

original: byang chub snying po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la brtse nas /
analyzed: byang chub snying po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la brtse nas /
translated: being affectionate to the bodhisattva who is situated in the essence of enlightenment,

original: de lta de ltar byang chub sems dpas /
analyzed: de lta de ltar byang chub sems dpas /
translated: in that way, in that way, the bodhisattva

original: byang chub sems dpa' la shin tu brtan pa'i sems nye bar skyed par byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la shin tu brtan pa'i sems nye bar skyed par byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: generates the very firm thought in the bodhisattva.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rang sems gdul ba'i don du ni //
analyzed: rang sems gdul ba'i don du ni //
translated: For the sake of taming one‚Äôs own mind,

original: bdag ni bdud nyid nye bar 'gro //
analyzed: bdag ni bdud nyid nye bar 'gro //
translated: I am the demon himself.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: Thus,

original: mgo rtsom pa'i @43a * //
analyzed: mgo rtsom pa'i @43a * //
translated: the beginning

original: rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis gang sems dang gang dpal rdo rje sems dpa' lha'i bu'i bdud du gnas pa de dang de ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis gang sems dang gang dpal rdo rje sems dpa' lha'i bu'i bdud du gnas pa de dang de ni /
translated: Whatever is the mind of the yogins and whatever is the divine youth Vajrasattva, that is the demon,

original: sgrub pa po sems dang chos nyid du lhan cig dbyer med par rang gi sems shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa po sems dang chos nyid du lhan cig dbyer med par rang gi sems shes par bya ste /
translated: that is to be known as one‚Äôs own mind, inseparable from the mind and reality of the adept.

original: de la 'dul ba dang bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / de'i don du bdag ni bdud nye bar 'gro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dul ba dang bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / de'i don du bdag ni bdud nye bar 'gro zhes pa'o //
translated: For the sake of subduing and teaching that, and for the sake of that, I go to the demon.

original: de la ji ltar bcom ldan 'das mngon par byang chub pa dang sangs rgyas yin zhe na zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la ji ltar bcom ldan 'das mngon par byang chub pa dang sangs rgyas yin zhe na zhes pa ni /
translated: How is it that the Blessed One is fully enlightened and a Buddha?

original: de la rang sems so sor rig pa ni zhes pa ni /üîΩtsi tta pra ti be dham ka ro mi /
analyzed: de la rang sems so sor rig pa ni zhes pa ni / tsi tta pra ti be dham ka ro mi /
translated: Here, the awareness of one‚Äôs own mind isüîΩcittapradƒ´pa·πÉ karoti.

original: zhes dang po nas bzung nas /
analyzed: zhes dang po nas bzung nas /
translated: Beginning from the first,

original: ji snyed du aom badzra a'atma konya ham /
analyzed: ji snyed du aom badzra a'atma konya ham /
translated: up to as much as o·πÉ vajra ƒÅtmƒÅko ‚Äôha·πÉ,

original: zhes pa'i bar du bsgoms pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du bsgoms pa ni /
translated: meditating up to that is

original: rang sems so sor rtog pa ni zhes pa'i sgra ni ci'i phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: rang sems so sor rtog pa ni zhes pa'i sgra ni ci'i phyir gyi don to //
translated: the word ‚Äúawareness‚Äù in ‚Äúawareness of one‚Äôs own mind.‚Äù The word ‚Äúawareness‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúwhy.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems mchog rdo rje nyid //
analyzed: byang chub sems mchog rdo rje nyid //
translated: The supreme mind of enlightenment is the very vajra.

original: ces pa ni ci'i phyir ji ltar gsungs pa'i rang sems so sor rtog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces pa ni ci'i phyir ji ltar gsungs pa'i rang sems so sor rtog pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the reason why, because of the individual investigation of one's own mind as it has been taught,

original: byang chub sems mchog rab rdo rje nyid du gyur pa de'i phyir de nyid mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems mchog rab rdo rje nyid du gyur pa de'i phyir de nyid mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: the supreme thought of enlightenment becomes the very vajra, and therefore it is the manifest enlightenment of that.

original: de kho na bshad pa de nyid de las shes pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na bshad pa de nyid de las shes pa ste /
translated: That reality is explained as being known from that,

original: rang gi sems so sor rtog pa de yis byang chub sems sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin de kho na nyid ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi sems so sor rtog pa de yis byang chub sems sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin de kho na nyid ces pa'i don to //
translated: and by that individual investigation of one's own mind, the perfection of giving of the thought of enlightenment, and the reality which is the nature of the perfection of wisdom, is the meaning of thatness.

original: des sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: des sangs rgyas te /
translated: By that, one becomes a buddha.

original: rang bya ni brlab mchog 'grub phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bya ni brlab mchog 'grub phyir ro //
translated: One's own action is the supreme consecration, for the sake of accomplishment.

original: zhes ba ni de la des zhes pa ni rjes snyegs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes ba ni de la des zhes pa ni rjes snyegs pa'o //
translated: Here, by that is the pursuit.

original: sems dpa'i rdo rjer gyur pa ni sems de yis sangs rgyas pa'i ngo bo ni des sangs rgyas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa'i rdo rjer gyur pa ni sems de yis sangs rgyas pa'i ngo bo ni des sangs rgyas zhes pa'o //
translated: The vajra of the thought of enlightenment is the nature of the buddhahood of that thought, and that is by that, one becomes a buddha.

original: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta sta tha ham /
analyzed: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta sta tha ham /
translated: Om, ya tha, all tathagatas, be gracious.

original: zhes sngags kyi don bsgom pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su bdag 'gyur ba'i rang byin brlab mchog 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes sngags kyi don bsgom pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su bdag 'gyur ba'i rang byin brlab mchog 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, by meditating on the meaning of the mantra, one attains the supreme self-consecration, which is the transformation of oneself into the form of the Buddha endowed with all aspects.

original: 'grub pa de las des sangs rgyas zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'grub pa de las des sangs rgyas zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: From that accomplishment, one becomes a Buddha, as indicated by the phrase one becomes a Buddha.

original: de la ji ltar bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje yin zhes pa la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de la ji ltar bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje yin zhes pa la sogs pas ni /
translated: Regarding that, the phrase just as the Blessed One VajrapƒÅ·πái... and so on,

original: de dbyer med ces pas ni sems can des sems ma yin pa thams cad gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: de dbyer med ces pas ni sems can des sems ma yin pa thams cad gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'joms pa'o //
translated: that indivisibility means that sentient beings destroy all non-mental things, which are the concepts of grasped and grasper.

original: so sor rtog pa dang zhes rgyu med pa'i chos thams cad ces gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa dang zhes rgyu med pa'i chos thams cad ces gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: Discernment and so on establishes all phenomena without cause.

original: sdang ba thams cad nges par gnon pa zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs ba nyon mongs pa ni drag po la sogs ba sems can 'joms pa la gnas pa ngag  @43b gi sdang ba thams cad ces pa'o //
analyzed: sdang ba thams cad nges par gnon pa zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs ba nyon mongs pa ni drag po la sogs ba sems can 'joms pa la gnas pa ngag  @43b gi sdang ba thams cad ces pa'o //
translated: Subduing all hatred means that the afflictions such as attachment are the hatred of all sentient beings such as Rudra, who are established in destroying sentient beings.

original: de dag nges par gnon zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bag chags kyi nyon mongs pa spang pa dang / drag po la sogs pa'i 'og mar ltung bar byas te /
analyzed: de dag nges par gnon zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bag chags kyi nyon mongs pa spang pa dang / drag po la sogs pa'i 'og mar ltung bar byas te /
translated: The phrase they are to be pressed down means that the afflictions of the latent tendencies of desire and so forth are to be abandoned, and that the lower ones such as Rudra are to be brought down.

original: byang chub chen po'i sems kyi rkang pas gnon pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i sems kyi rkang pas gnon pa'o //
translated: They are to be pressed down with the foot of the mind of great awakening.

original: sangs rgyas kun dngos rdo rje ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun dngos rdo rje ni //
translated: The vajra which is the nature of all buddhasüîΩis the five-pronged [vajra].

original: byang chub sems sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad gcig par 'dus pa'i ye shes ni sangs rgyas kun zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad gcig par 'dus pa'i ye shes ni sangs rgyas kun zhes pa'o //
translated: The perfection of generosity, the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of diligence, and the gnosis that is the unification of all buddhas is called all buddhas.

original: de'i dngos de'i rgyu ca na rtse lnga pa ni rdo rje ni zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos de'i rgyu ca na rtse lnga pa ni rdo rje ni zhes pa'o //
translated: The nature of that is the five-pronged vajra.üîΩWhat is that?

original: de gang yin zhe na gsungs pa /üîΩbyang chub sems bdag brtan pa yin //
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na gsungs pa / byang chub sems bdag brtan pa yin //
translated: It is said:

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: The mind of awakening is the self-steadfastness.

original: bdag kho na rnam par rtog pa thams cad med pas byang chub sems dbyer med pa'o de rnam par 'jug pa yis bya ste /
analyzed: bdag kho na rnam par rtog pa thams cad med pas byang chub sems dbyer med pa'o de rnam par 'jug pa yis bya ste /
translated: Since only the self is without all conceptual thoughts, the bodhicitta is indivisible.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dngos rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dngos rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i gzugs so //
translated: That is to be engaged by the form of the five-pronged vajra, the actuality of all buddhas.

original: bstan pa thams cad grub don du //
analyzed: bstan pa thams cad grub don du //
translated: For the sake of accomplishing all teachings,üîΩand so forth.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar gsungs pa'i rdo rje kho na /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar gsungs pa'i rdo rje kho na /
translated: The vajra as it is taught is the five-pronged vajra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bdag gis kun tu bzang po zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bdag gis kun tu bzang po zhes bya ba /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is the one called Samantabhadra.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sprul par byas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sprul par byas te /
translated: The bodhisattva is the emanation.

original: kun tu bzang po de la ji ltar gsungs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs 'khor los sgyur ba nyid dbang bskur nas /
analyzed: kun tu bzang po de la ji ltar gsungs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs 'khor los sgyur ba nyid dbang bskur nas /
translated: That Samantabhadra, having been empowered with the universal monarch of the family of all tathƒÅgatas as it is taught,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bstan pa 'grub pa'i don du phyag la byin pas ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bstan pa 'grub pa'i don du phyag la byin pas ni /
translated: was given the vajra in the hand for the sake of accomplishing the teachings of all tathƒÅgatas.

original: de'i tshe de nas phyag na rdo rje zhes btags so //
analyzed: de'i tshe de nas phyag na rdo rje zhes btags so //
translated: At that time, he was designated as VajrapƒÅ·πái.

original: rdo rjes nye bar btags pa'i phyag dang ldan pa de la phyag na rdo rje gsungs so //
analyzed: rdo rjes nye bar btags pa'i phyag dang ldan pa de la phyag na rdo rje gsungs so //
translated: He is called VajrapƒÅ·πái because he is endowed with a hand that is marked with a vajra.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das dang po'i rigs 'byung ba yin zhe na zhes pa'i lan la /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das dang po'i rigs 'byung ba yin zhe na zhes pa'i lan la /
translated: How is the Blessed One the first family?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúFrom Praj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ,‚Äù and so on. This is easy to understand.

original: 'dul phyir rdo rje sems dpa' ni //
analyzed: 'dul phyir rdo rje sems dpa' ni //
translated: In order to tame, Vajrasattva

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' kho na byang chub sems kyi mtshan nyid thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin phar yongs su btags pa byang chub kyi sems sems can gyi khams 'dul ba'i phyir na brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' kho na byang chub sems kyi mtshan nyid thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin phar yongs su btags pa byang chub kyi sems sems can gyi khams 'dul ba'i phyir na brtsams pa'o //
translated: and so on. Glorious Vajrasattva alone is the characteristic of the mind of enlightenment, the nature of the perfection of method, and the perfection of wisdom that is fully imputed. He is the mind of enlightenment that is composed in order to tame the realm of sentient beings.

original: skye bdag ni rigs yin no //
analyzed: skye bdag ni rigs yin no //
translated: The family is the nature of birth.üîΩThis is the family of the TathƒÅgata,

original: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa las byung ba /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa las byung ba /
translated: which arises from the TathƒÅgata.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
translated: Vajrasattva and so on.

original: gzugs rnams kyang rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams ni @44a * //
analyzed: gzugs rnams kyang rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams ni @44a * //
translated: The forms are also the forms of Vajrasattva and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dag go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dag go //
translated: They are the families of the TathƒÅgata.

original: de ltar rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / las kyi rdo rje las byung ba'i rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / las kyi rdo rje las byung ba'i rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs so //
translated: Thus, the forms of Vajra, Jewel, Lotus, and Action Vajra, which arise from the vajra, are the Tathagata family.

original: de ltar rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / las kyi rdo rje las byung ba'i rdo rje h'um mdzas la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams kyang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rigs bdag zhes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / las kyi rdo rje las byung ba'i rdo rje h'um mdzas la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams kyang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rigs bdag zhes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the forms of Vajra, Jewel, Lotus, and Action Vajra, which arise from the vajra, are also called the lords of the vajra and so on families.

original: da ni 'dod pa'i sgra'i don dang / thar pa'i sgra'i don gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'dod pa'i sgra'i don dang / thar pa'i sgra'i don gsungs pa /
translated: Now, he states the meaning of the word desire and the meaning of the word liberation.

original: de la ji ltar bcom ldan 'das 'dod pa'i thar pa yin zhes na zhes pa la sogs pa mngon du byas nas lan btab pa /üîΩdngos grub thams cad rjes chags phyir //
analyzed: de la ji ltar bcom ldan 'das 'dod pa'i thar pa yin zhes na zhes pa la sogs pa mngon du byas nas lan btab pa / dngos grub thams cad rjes chags phyir //
translated: There, one might ask, How is the Blessed One the liberation of desire? and so on. Having stated this, he replies:üîΩBecause of the passion for all powers.

original: zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dngos grub thams cad ces pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dngos grub thams cad ces pa ste /
translated: All powers means the powers of glorious Vajrasattva and so on.

original: de dag gi rjes su chags pa'i phyir zhes pa ni mgo brtsams pa'i rnal 'byor pas yang nas yang du mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su chags pa'i phyir zhes pa ni mgo brtsams pa'i rnal 'byor pas yang nas yang du mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: Because of his passion for them, the yogi who has begun should manifest them again and again.

original: de'i phyir na dngos grub kyi rjes su chags pas bcom ldan 'das 'dod chags zhes te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na dngos grub kyi rjes su chags pas bcom ldan 'das 'dod chags zhes te /
translated: Therefore, because of his passion for the powers, the Lord is called Passion.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bskyed pa la mngon du byas nas 'dod pa'i phyir te gsungs pas /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bskyed pa la mngon du byas nas 'dod pa'i phyir te gsungs pas /
translated: Because he manifests the generation of glorious Vajrasattva and so forth, and because he desires them, it is said:

original: 'dod chags chen po bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po bcom ldan 'das //
translated: The Great Passion is the Lord.

original: zhes pa ste mi dmigs pa'i snying rje chen po'i mtshan nyid bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin chen po ci'i phyir kun du rtog pa de'i phyir 'dod chags chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste mi dmigs pa'i snying rje chen po'i mtshan nyid bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin chen po ci'i phyir kun du rtog pa de'i phyir 'dod chags chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The Lord is the Great Passion because of his great compassion, which is characterized by non-apprehension.

original: kun 'grub zad med bde ba ni //
analyzed: kun 'grub zad med bde ba ni //
translated: The accomplishment of all, inexhaustible bliss,

original: bde ba chen po zhes 'dod do //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba chen po zhes 'dod do // zhes pa ni /
translated: is asserted to be Great Bliss.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dngos grub rnams ni kun 'grub ces pa'o //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dngos grub rnams ni kun 'grub ces pa'o //
translated: The powers of glorious Vajrasattva are the accomplishment of all.

original: de yis bstan pa ni zad med ces pa'o //
analyzed: de yis bstan pa ni zad med ces pa'o //
translated: His teaching is inexhaustible.

original: gang bde pa nye bar skye ba ni gzung 'dzin rnam par rtog pa med pa'i 'brel pa ni de ni thar pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang bde pa nye bar skye ba ni gzung 'dzin rnam par rtog pa med pa'i 'brel pa ni de ni thar pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: The arising of that which is blissful is the connection of the non-conceptualization of subject and object, which is called liberation.

original: gsang chen zhes pa la sogs pa ni sgra'i don gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsang chen zhes pa la sogs pa ni sgra'i don gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of the words ‚Äúgreat secret‚Äù and so forth is stated:

original: gsang ba khrag 'thung zhes sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba khrag 'thung zhes sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe secret is the blood-drinkers and so forth.‚Äù

original: dpal khrag 'thung ni gsang ba chen po'i sgrar gsungs so //
analyzed: dpal khrag 'thung ni gsang ba chen po'i sgrar gsungs so //
translated: The glorious blood-drinkers are said to be the sound of the great secret.

original: ci'i phyir yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Why is that? It is said:

original: phyag rgya chen po 'grub pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po 'grub pa'i phyir // zhes pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to accomplish the great seal.‚Äù

original: chen po yang de phyag rgya yang de nyid pas phyag rgya chen po zhes te /
analyzed: chen po yang de phyag rgya yang de nyid pas phyag rgya chen po zhes te /
translated: That is also great, and it is also the seal, so it is the great seal.

original: mi bskyod pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi mtshan nyid me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi mtshan nyid me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: It is the seal of mirror-like wisdom, the nature of Akshobhya‚Äôs mind, the characteristic of enlightenment.

original: des 'grub pa'i phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: des 'grub pa'i phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: Because of that, it is said ‚Äúin order to accomplish.‚Äù

original: snying rje chen @44b po'i khro bos bzang po la sogs pa'i khro bor gzhom pas so //
analyzed: snying rje chen @44b po'i khro bos bzang po la sogs pa'i khro bor gzhom pas so //
translated: It is the best because it conquers the wrath of Bhadra and so forth with great compassionate wrath.

original: mchog ni padma 'dzin rgyal po //
analyzed: mchog ni padma 'dzin rgyal po //
translated: The supreme is the lotus-holding king.

original: zhes pa'o // ci'i phyir yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // ci'i phyir yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Why is it so? It is stated:

original: dam tshig dam pa shes ldan phyir //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: dam tshig dam pa shes ldan phyir // zhes pa ste /
translated: Because of knowing the supreme commitment.

original: dam tshig ces pa ni mi 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: dam tshig ces pa ni mi 'da' ba'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúcommitment‚Äù means not transgressing.

original: dam pa yang de shes pa yang de nyid pas dam pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa yang de shes pa yang de nyid pas dam pa shes pa'o //
translated: It is supreme and it is knowledge, so it is supreme knowledge.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin dag go zhes gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin dag go zhes gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: It is the ascertainment that all phenomena are pure by nature.

original: de dang gang dag ldan pa de dag ni dam pa shes ldan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dang gang dag ldan pa de dag ni dam pa shes ldan zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who possess that are called ‚Äúendowed with supreme knowledge.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: They are the tathƒÅgatas.

original: 'di ltar gsung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsung bar 'gyur te /
translated: It is stated like this:

original: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis so sor kun tu rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid padma 'dzin 'dar med pa de'i phyir dam tshig dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis so sor kun tu rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid padma 'dzin 'dar med pa de'i phyir dam tshig dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the supreme commitment of all tathƒÅgatas, which is the nature of the wisdom of discernment, the holder of the lotus is unshakable. Therefore, it is called the supreme commitment.‚Äù

original: dgyes pa dam pa nyi ma ste //
analyzed: dgyes pa dam pa nyi ma ste //
translated: The supreme joy is the sun.

original: zhes pa ni dgyes pa dam pa shes rab ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dgyes pa dam pa shes rab ste /
translated: Supreme joy is wisdom.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i nyi ma zhes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i nyi ma zhes so //
translated: It is called the supramundane sun.

original: de zhes pa'i sgra ni nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: de zhes pa'i sgra ni nges pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù has the meaning of ascertainment.

original: sbyin pa la sogs mchog grub phyir //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs mchog grub phyir //
translated: For the accomplishment of the supreme generosity and so forth.

original: zhes pa ni rdzas la sogs pa'i gtor ma ni sbyin ba zhes te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdzas la sogs pa'i gtor ma ni sbyin ba zhes te /
translated: The sacrificial cake of substances and so forth is called ‚Äúgenerosity.‚Äù

original: zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / skyabs kyi sbyin pa dang / byams pa'i sbyin pa dang / dbang bskur ba'i sbyin pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / skyabs kyi sbyin pa dang / byams pa'i sbyin pa dang / dbang bskur ba'i sbyin pa zhes pa'o //
translated: It is the generosity of material things, the generosity of refuge, the generosity of love, and the generosity of empowerment.

original: sogs pa zhes pa'i sgra ni byang chub sems dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'du ba'i ye shes thams cad gsung ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes pa'i sgra ni byang chub sems dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'du ba'i ye shes thams cad gsung ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so forth‚Äù indicates the generosity of the spirit of enlightenment, the generosity of the perfection of wisdom, the generosity of the perfection of diligence, and the generosity of all the gnoses of the assembly.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos de dag 'dul ba'i sems can gyi rgyud la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos de dag 'dul ba'i sems can gyi rgyud la /
translated: Those dharmas of generosity and so forth are to be generated in the mind-streams of the disciples.

original: bskyed par bya ba'i mchog 'grub phyir //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i mchog 'grub phyir //
translated: For the accomplishment of the supreme that is to be generated.

original: zhes pa'o // bsgrub pa de'i phyir na yid bzhin nor bu 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // bsgrub pa de'i phyir na yid bzhin nor bu 'dra ba ste /
translated: For the sake of that accomplishment, it is like a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: dga' ba rdo rje nyi ma yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba rdo rje nyi ma yin no //
translated: The vajra of joy is the sun.

original: thams cad bdag nyid rtag tu bzhugs //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid rtag tu bzhugs //
translated: It always abides in the nature of all.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub sems la sogs pa'i sgrub pa dang ldan pa ni thams cad bdag nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub sems la sogs pa'i sgrub pa dang ldan pa ni thams cad bdag nyid ces pa'o //
translated: He who is endowed with the practice of the Thought of Enlightenment, etc. is the ‚Äúuniversal self.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid de la rtag par dus thams cad gnas pa ni dpal rta mchog go //
analyzed: bdag nyid de la rtag par dus thams cad gnas pa ni dpal rta mchog go //
translated: He who always abides in that self at all times is the glorious Hayagriva.

original: ci'i phyir yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Why is it so? It is said:

original: rdo rje rta mchog las nyid phyir //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje rta mchog las nyid phyir // zhes pa ste /
translated: Because of the very nature of the Vajra Horse.

original: brtson 'grus kyi kha lo bsgyur ba'i las rang gi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir dpal rta mchog ces so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi kha lo bsgyur ba'i las rang gi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir dpal rta mchog ces so //
translated: Because of the very nature of the activity of the charioteer of effort, it is the glorious Hayagriva.

original: sangs rgyas kun dngos sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun dngos sems dpa' ste /
translated: The Being is the essence of all Buddhas.

original: zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / don yod par grub pa rnams ni sangs rgyas kun zhes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / don yod par grub pa rnams ni sangs rgyas kun zhes so //
translated: Akshobhya, Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, and Amoghasiddhi are the ‚Äúall Buddhas.‚Äù

original: de'i rang bzhin ni dngos sems @45a * //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni dngos sems @45a * //
translated: His nature is the ‚ÄúBeing.‚Äù

original: dpa' ste zhes pa ni dpal rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: dpa' ste zhes pa ni dpal rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: The glorious Vairochana is the ‚Äúessence.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ro gcig tu 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ro gcig tu 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is the union of all the Buddhas in one taste.

original: de kho na bshad pa /
analyzed: de kho na bshad pa /
translated: That is explained:

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas phyir rnam snang mdzad //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas phyir rnam snang mdzad //
translated: For the sake of perfect Buddhahood, Vairochana.

original: ces so // rdo rje sems dpa' rgyal chen po //üîΩye shes rdo rje 'dzin mchog phyir //
analyzed: ces so // rdo rje sems dpa' rgyal chen po // ye shes rdo rje 'dzin mchog phyir //
translated: The great king Vajrasattva,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: for the sake of the supreme holder of the vajra of intuition.

original: de la rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni sems dpa' byin gyi rlabs kyi sbyor ba las bskyed pa /
analyzed: de la rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni sems dpa' byin gyi rlabs kyi sbyor ba las bskyed pa /
translated: Here, ‚ÄúVajrasattva‚Äù is generated from the yoga of the blessing of the being,

original: rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa /
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa /
translated: holding vajra and bell,

original: dpal bde mchog ma la sogs pa'i tshogs kyi dbus na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dpal bde mchog ma la sogs pa'i tshogs kyi dbus na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: dwelling in the midst of the assembly of Shri Heruka, etc.

original: rgyal po zhes pa ni dpal bde mchog ma la sog spa'i lha mo'i dbus na bzhugs pa /
analyzed: rgyal po zhes pa ni dpal bde mchog ma la sog spa'i lha mo'i dbus na bzhugs pa /
translated: ‚ÄúKing‚Äù means dwelling in the midst of the goddesses of Shri Heruka, etc.,

original: rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa /
analyzed: rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa /
translated: holding vajra and bell,

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs de la kun tu 'gro ba rgyal zhing snang ba ni rgyal chen po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs de la kun tu 'gro ba rgyal zhing snang ba ni rgyal chen po'o //
translated: the form of Vajrasattva, the great king, is all-pervading, victorious, and manifest.

original: ye shes rdo rje 'dzin mchog phyir //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje 'dzin mchog phyir //
translated: For the sake of the supreme holder of the vajra of intuition,

original: zhes pa ni gsang ba chen po lnga'i de kho na nyid kyi ye shes ston par byed pa des thob pa de las byung ba'i rtse lnga pa'i dang po'i rdo rje ni ye shes rdo rje zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gsang ba chen po lnga'i de kho na nyid kyi ye shes ston par byed pa des thob pa de las byung ba'i rtse lnga pa'i dang po'i rdo rje ni ye shes rdo rje zhes pa'o //
translated: The one who reveals the intuition of the reality of the five great secrets is the five-pronged original vajra arisen from that attainment, called the intuition vajra.

original: rdo rje de shin tu sbyor ba'i phyag gis 'dzin pas na /
analyzed: rdo rje de shin tu sbyor ba'i phyag gis 'dzin pas na /
translated: Since he holds that vajra with a hand of intense yoga,

original: ye shes rdo rje 'dzin mchog ces so //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje 'dzin mchog ces so //
translated: he is the supreme intuition vajra holder.

original: de yang dpal rdo rje sems dpa' kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang dpal rdo rje sems dpa' kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, he is glorious Vajrasattva himself.

original: des ni 'di gsung par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni 'di gsung par 'gyur te /
translated: He declares this:

original: dpal khrag 'thung dang / gar gyi dbang phyug dang / nyi ma dang / rta mchog dang / dpal rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag nyid ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: dpal khrag 'thung dang / gar gyi dbang phyug dang / nyi ma dang / rta mchog dang / dpal rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag nyid ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: The nature of glorious Heruka, Natha, Sun, Supreme Horse, glorious Vairochana, and so forth is glorious Vajrasattva.

original: ye shes thams cad 'dus pa'i ngo bor bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes thams cad 'dus pa'i ngo bor bshad pa'o //
translated: He is explained as the essence of the collection of all intuitions.

original: da ni rnam pa gsum gyi sgra'i don bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni rnam pa gsum gyi sgra'i don bshad pa /
translated: Now, the meaning of the term ‚Äúthreefold‚Äù is explained:

original: de lta ji ltar bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: de lta ji ltar bcom ldan 'das //
translated: How is the Lord

original: rnam pa gsum yin zhes pa sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum yin zhes pa sogs pa ste /
translated: threefold?

original: de la / 'jig rten gsum dag mtha' yas phyir //
analyzed: de la / 'jig rten gsum dag mtha' yas phyir //
translated: because the three worlds are limitless,

original: zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'o //
translated: the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: 'jig rten gsum zhes pa ni snod bcud kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum zhes pa ni snod bcud kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The three worlds are the nature of the environment and its inhabitants.

original: ci'i phyir khams gsum nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khams gsum nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Why are there only three realms?

original: mtha' yas phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' yas phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: Because they are limitless.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi chos nyid gang yin pa de ni gdod ma dang tha ma med pa'i mtha' med pa dang bdag kyang gdod ma dang tha ma med pa'i mtha' med pa'i rang bzhin nyid pas lhan cig dbyer med pa mnyam pa nyid bsam pa dbang du byasüîΩnas gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi chos nyid gang yin pa de ni gdod ma dang tha ma med pa'i mtha' med pa dang bdag kyang gdod ma dang tha ma med pa'i mtha' med pa'i rang bzhin nyid pas lhan cig dbyer med pa mnyam pa nyid bsam pa dbang du byas nas gsungs te /
translated: The nature of the three worlds is that they are limitless without a beginning or end. Since the self is also the nature of being limitless without a beginning or end, they are inseparable and equal.

original: 'jig rten gsum bdag mtha' yas phyir //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum bdag mtha' yas phyir //
translated: The three worlds are limitless because the self is limitless.

original: zhes pa'o // des ltar 'jig rten gsum gyi ngo bos rnam pa gsum bstan nas da ni srid pa'i ngo bor gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // des ltar 'jig rten gsum gyi ngo bos rnam pa gsum bstan nas da ni srid pa'i ngo bor gsungs pa /
translated: Having explained the three worlds in that way, now, the three existences are explained:

original: @45b 'dul phyir srid gsum mchog gsum bdag / ces pa ste /
analyzed: @45b 'dul phyir srid gsum mchog gsum bdag / ces pa ste /
translated: For the sake of taming, the three existences are the three supreme ones.

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa gsum ni srid pa gsum zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa gsum ni srid pa gsum zhes pa'o //
translated: The three realms of desire, form, and formlessness are the three existences.

original: ci'i phyir na khyod srid pa gsum yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na khyod srid pa gsum yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Why are you the three existences?üîΩIt is said:

original: 'dul ba'i don du zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i don du zhes pa ste /
translated: For the sake of taming.

original: khams gsum du rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs kyis sems can gyi khams 'dul ba'i don du de'i gzugs su sprul pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: khams gsum du rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs kyis sems can gyi khams 'dul ba'i don du de'i gzugs su sprul pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: In order to tame the realm of sentient beings in the three realms with the form of Vajrasattva, you emanate in that form.

original: rdo rje 'dzin dang 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / nam mkha'i snying po'i gzugs su snang bas /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin dang 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / nam mkha'i snying po'i gzugs su snang bas /
translated: Appearing in the form of Vajra Holder, Loke≈õvara, and ƒÄkƒÅ≈õagarbha,

original: dkon mchog gsum zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum zhes pa'o //
translated: you are the three jewels.

original: stobs bzangs dang / 'dod pa'i lha dang / gnas kyi mnga' bdag gi gzugs su snang bas mchog gsum mo //
analyzed: stobs bzangs dang / 'dod pa'i lha dang / gnas kyi mnga' bdag gi gzugs su snang bas mchog gsum mo //
translated: Appearing in the form of Balabhadra, the desire realm gods, and the lord of the abodes, you are the three supreme ones.

original: 'jig rten gsum zhes pa ni sa 'og gi 'jig rten dang sa steng gi 'jig rten dang / sa bla'i 'jig rten ni gsum zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum zhes pa ni sa 'og gi 'jig rten dang sa steng gi 'jig rten dang / sa bla'i 'jig rten ni gsum zhes pa'o //
translated: The three worlds are the underworld, the world above, and the world of the earth.

original: de'i gzugs su sprul nas sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i gzugs su sprul nas sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir na /
translated: Emanating in those forms, you act for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das thams cad du 'jig rten gsum zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thams cad du 'jig rten gsum zhes pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One is the three worlds in all respects.

original: khams gsum yin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: khams gsum yin zhes pa ni /
translated: The three realms are

original: sems can thams cad nyid la sogs pa dang / rjes su gnas pa'i g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i dngos po'i bdag nyid kyis 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i rang bzhin gyis bdag ni khams gsum zhes te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad nyid la sogs pa dang / rjes su gnas pa'i g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i dngos po'i bdag nyid kyis 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i rang bzhin gyis bdag ni khams gsum zhes te /
translated: all beings and so forth, and with the nature of the moving and unmoving things that abide in them, he is the nature of the desire, form, and formless realms.

original: thams cad nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with all of them and so forth.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das de thams cad nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das de thams cad nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is the Blessed One all of that?üîΩIt is said:

original: gsungs pa / de la ji ltar bcom ldan 'das thams cad nyid ce na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / de la ji ltar bcom ldan 'das thams cad nyid ce na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: How is the Blessed One all of that? and so forth.üîΩThere,

original: de la / sems can bsod nams cher 'phags pa //
analyzed: de la / sems can bsod nams cher 'phags pa //
translated: the greatly exalted merit of beings

original: zhes pa ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam bsags pa ni sems can rnams kyi bsod nams zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam bsags pa ni sems can rnams kyi bsod nams zhes pa'o //
translated: is the accumulation of the ten virtuous paths of action of beings, which is called merit.

original: cher 'phags zhes pa ni rin po che sna bzhi la sogs pa'i gzugs su ri rab la sogs pa'i bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: cher 'phags zhes pa ni rin po che sna bzhi la sogs pa'i gzugs su ri rab la sogs pa'i bskyed pa'o //
translated: Greatly exalted means the creation of Meru and so forth in the form of the four precious substances and so forth.

original: bskyed pa de yang gzugs kyi shas kyi dngos kyis sems can gyi sems las dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa de yang gzugs kyi shas kyi dngos kyis sems can gyi sems las dbyer med pa'o //
translated: And that creation is not separate from the mind of sentient beings by the power of the form aspect.

original: de bas na de'i rang bzhin bzhin nyid kyang bdag yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de'i rang bzhin bzhin nyid kyang bdag yin no //
translated: Therefore, its nature is also the self.

original: de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: mi g-yo ba kho na bdag ces pa ni /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba kho na bdag ces pa ni /
translated: The self is indeed the immovable.

original: sems med pa'i dngos po rnams ni mi g-yo thams cad ces pa ste /
analyzed: sems med pa'i dngos po rnams ni mi g-yo thams cad ces pa ste /
translated: The immovable is all things that are not mind.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das mi g-yo thams cad yin no //üîΩg-yo ba ste zhes pa ni sems kyi dbang gis lhag par stobs kyi yul du 'gro ba ni g-yo ba zhes te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das mi g-yo thams cad yin no // g-yo ba ste zhes pa ni sems kyi dbang gis lhag par stobs kyi yul du 'gro ba ni g-yo ba zhes te /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One is all the immovable.üîΩThe moving is the mind.

original: sems dang ldan pa'i @46a * //
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa'i @46a * //
translated: The moving is the mind, because it goes to the object by the power of the mind.

original: ngo bo'o // de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: ngo bo'o // de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sems 'du byed phyir zhes pa'o //
